It must be a relief to ActiBlizz to have some good Diablo 4 news, given how everyone on Earth is ragging on Diablo Immortal 24/8 (when we are not open-mouthed at the stream of terrible news about the company, from numerous allegations of harrassment, misconduct and discrimination, to the company advising shareholders to not approve a proposal to report on harassment and discrimination). But at the Xbox & Bethesda Showcase tonight they were able to share that Diablo 4 is coming out next year for some much anticipated ARPG antics. Why, that's the Diablo game people keep saying they want!
Plus, the Necromancer is confirmed as the fifth playable class. There's a moody trailer that tries to make being a Necromancer sound twisted and dangerous and a hard path to walk, but it mostly makes it sound like Necromancers are cool badasses with loads of skeleton best friends.
Read more
articles.title: Diablo 4 is out next year, confirms Necromancer class and makes it sound rad as hell

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Rumours spread this past week that Hideo Kojima's next would be called Overdose, and a return to the horror genre. Well, Kojima appeared during tonight's Microsoft conference and confirmed: yes, he is making a game of some kind. And that's it.

 
Read more
articles.title: Hideo Kojima is indeed making a new game of some sort

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
The next expansion for open-world racer Forza Horizon 5 will once again feature the gravity-defying stunts and tracks of the Hot Wheels toys. The expansion launches on July 19th and it’s the second such DLC, following on from similar orange loop-de-loops made for Forza Horizon 3. Buckle up and try not to chuck when you watch the trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Forza Horizon 5 is getting a Hot Wheels expansion in the skies of Mexico

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
After spinning an action-RPG off Minecraft in 2020 with Minecraft Dungeons, Mojang Studios today announced the blocky builder is venturing into another new genre with an "action strategy game" named Minecraft Legends. Due to launch in 2023, Mojang are making it with Blackbird Interactive, the studio behind Homeworld 3 and Hardspace: Shipbreaker. Have a peek in the announcement trailer below.
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft Legends is an "action strategy" spin-off coming in 2023

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Gothic puzzle platformer The Last Case Of Benedict Fox was announced at today’s Xbox & Bethesda Games Showcase, but it’s bringing a demon along for the ride. Set in Boston, Massachusetts in 1925, The Last Case Of Benedict Fox follows, you guessed it, self-appointed detective Benedict Fox as he searches through a dodgy mansion. Watch the suitably moody trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Survive Lovecraftian Metroidvania The Last Case Of Benedict Fox with help from your inner demon

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
After many delays, Overwatch 2 has a release date. Blizzard's sequel will launch on October 4th - and it'll have a new free-to-play model when it does.

 
Read more
articles.title: Overwatch 2 coming this October and will be free-to-play

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
Peaceful farming sims are always in, really, and Lightyear Frontier is a) in space and b) has a mighty morphin' tractor mech. Digging up a gameplay trailer at today’s Xthesda Games Showcase, Lightyear Frontier is taking farming to the final frontier in Spring 2023 - but that frontier includes Game Pass on day one. This planet may be on the edge of the galaxy, but it has good wifi.
Read more
articles.title: Give Stardew Valley a giant tractor mech and you've got Lightyear Frontier

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
The much-anticipated metroidvania Hollow Knight: Silksong finally gave another peek at the beautiful and awful things awaiting us in a new kingdom of insects. Microsoft's NotE3 showcase brought a new trailer, which didn't help with the info bugheads really crave—a release date—but did announce the exciting news that Silksong will be on Game Pass at launch. Here, come watch, check out some of the beautiful and awful things waiting to murder you.
Read more
articles.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong will be on Game Pass at launch

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
If you’re a fan of the comedy stylings of Rick And Morty and its co-creator Justin Roiland then you’ll probably be all over the wacky sci-fi shooter High On Life. The game was announced at today’s Xbox & Bethesda Showcase, and it seems Roiland is voicing its main character. Feel free to chuckle at the trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Comedy sci-fi FPS High On Life’s talking weapons will chat you up

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
It was on the cards, and tonight at the XBox & Bethesda Showcase we indeed got a look at some vampire slaying in Redfall. Arkane's spooky co-op FPS has been on my most anticipated list for a while, especially because I was hoping the studio would put their signature weird twist on things. Judging by the big guns and big abilities you have at your disposal, they have - and the vampires should be watching their be-caped backs. Never thought I'd see the day when someone made being a vampire hunter look cooler than being a vamp, but we might be getting there. 
Read more
articles.title: Redfall's vampires can't compete with your big tech and magic elevators

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Here's a thing: Riot's games are coming to Game Pass, including League Of Legends, Valorant and Legends Of Runeterra. Those are free-to-play games, which means what you'll really getting for your subscription is access to some of the bits that would normally be locked behind real money or the grind. In League Of Legends, for example, a Game Pass subscription will unlock all 160+ of the MOBA's champions.

 
Read more
articles.title: Every League Of Legends champion will soon be available via Game Pass

articles.author: Rebecca Jones
articles.description:
What better way to spend a Sunday evening than by settling down to watch this year's PC Gaming Show, brought to you courtesy of cheery RPS fanzine PC Gamer as part of this year's Not-E3 festivities? It's a guides team takeover tonight as Hayden and Rebecca, RPS's duo of in-house Guides Writers, wrestle control of the liveblog away from our more chat-fatigued colleagues to bring you our highly unique blend of weird perspectives and in-jokes once it all kicks off at 8:30pm BST / 3:30pm EDT / 12:30pm PDT.
Read more
articles.title: Liveblog: PC Gaming Show 2022

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Not-E3 2022 continues today with the Xbox and Bethesda Games Showcase, and we’ll be liveblogging it right here. Will we see more of Starfield that isn’t CGI target footage and concept art? Could we get a closer look at Playground Games’ mysterious new Fable? Will Redfall get its first major public appearance since, uh, the last the Xbox and Bethesda Games Showcase? Dunno, but you can watch the whole show via the stream embedded below, and follow along with commentary from myself and vid bud Liam. The curtain raises at 6pm BST / 7pm CEST / 1pm ET.

 
Read more
articles.title: Liveblog: Xbox and Bethesda Games Showcase 2022

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
The trailer for Morbid Metal from tonight's Future Games Show had a lot of metal (the music genre) and metal (the stuff you make blades out of). Morbid Metal is a hack 'n' slash, but the difference here is that you have four different mech lads at your disposal, and you can morph between them whenever you like. This real-time switching means Morbid Metal moves very quickly. You might think hyphenated phrases like "high-octane", "action-packed", and "fast-paced" are moving in the direction of this game, but buddy this is going at such speed that they're already here.
Read more
articles.title: Smash four different robots into other robots in whip-fast roguelite Morbid Metal

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Homeworld 3, threequel to the OG melancholy spaceship strategy series, has been delayed into the first half of next year. The developers say they need more time to make the engine trails glow just right, and to make the derelict megastructures mega enough. We will apparently see more of the game in action this August, though.

 
Read more
articles.title: Homeworld 3 has been delayed until 2023, but we'll see more of it in August

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Sci-fi platformer Planet Of Lana seems like a sweet, scenic adventure with an alien monkey butler, and today’s Future Games Show had a little more gameplay to share. I mentioned Planet Of Lana earlier this week in my Day Of The Devs 2022 round-up, because it featured in that indie showcase too. Check out the trailer if you missed it on Thursday, it’s quite charming.

 
Read more
articles.title: Planet Of Lana is an eye-popping sci-fi platformer with an alien monkey butler

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na světě je první beta verze budoucího vydání kancelářského balíku LibreOffice 7.4. Přináší třeba 16× víc sloupců v Calcu či podporu WebP.
articles.title: Co se chystá pro LibreOffice 7.4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: O víkendu proběhl dlouho očekávaný další ročník konference InstallFest. Mluvilo se o řízení robotů Linuxem, monitorování Wi-Fi sítí, stavbě meteoradarů, rodině Wi-Fi čipů ESP32 či stavu připojení k internetu.
articles.title: Robotičtí záchranáři, jak funguje RFID a jak se staví meteoradar

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Ve třetí části seriálu o tvorbě her pro NES se nejprve seznámíme s některými triky nabízenými assemblerem ca65 a pak si ukážeme tvorbu zvuků. Taktéž si (prozatím bez příkladu) řekneme, jak se na NESu pracuje s grafikou.
articles.title: Základy tvorby her pro herní konzoli NES: triky nabízené assemblerem, tvorba zvuků a grafiky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: V dnešní části se krátce podíváme na nový videopřevodník, a především na zařízení SD2iEC, tvořící moderní úložiště ke Commodoru 64, jak jej zprovoznit a ovládat.
articles.title: Projekt C64: moderní úložiště SD2iEC

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Thunderbird se chystá na mobilní telefony, ale úplně jinak, než jsme si mysleli. Místo vývoje nové mobilní verze se ji stane populární K-9 Mail. Ten se promění v Thunderbird pro Android.
articles.title: K-9 Mail se mění na Thunderbird pro Android, vývojáři odhalili plány

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Jedním z rozdílů mezi knihovnami Matplotlib a Bokeh je fakt, že Bokeh umožňuje na plochu stránky s grafem vložit i interaktivní ovládací prvky. Uživatel tak může měnit styl zobrazení grafu či určitých dat.
articles.title: Knihovna Bokeh: zobrazení většího množství grafů, interaktivní prvky na stránce s grafy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: O víkendu 11. a 12. června proběhl další ročník tradiční pražské linuxové konference InstallFest. Podívejte do přednáškových sálů, na workshopy a na stánky a třeba také na techniku z městských autobusů.
articles.title: Fotogalerie: neděle na konferenci InstallFest 2022

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Kopřiva)
articles.description: V dnešním díle Postřehů se podíváme na cvičení Cyber Europe 2022, nový rámec pro řízení rizik dodavatelských řetězců MITRE SoT i netradiční přístup ke komunikaci ze strany ransomwarové skupiny LockBit…
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: (kybernetickým) cvičením ke zdraví

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Dvěma nadšencům se povedlo nabootovat linuxové jádro na Apple iPad Air 2. Legendární hra Doom byla portována na coreboot. DragonFly BSD nově umožňuje přidat popisy síťových rozhraní. Americká společnost System76 otevře distribuční centrum v Evropě.
articles.title: Linux spuštěný na iPadu Air 2, Doom v corebootu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: O víkendu 11. a 12. června probíhá další ročník tradiční pražské linuxové konference InstallFest. Podívejte do přednáškových sálů, na workshopy a na stánky a třeba také na robota řízeného Linuxem.
articles.title: Fotogalerie: sobota na konferenci InstallFest 2022

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na serveru GOG.com (link uprostřed stránky) je možné získat zdarma Sci-Fi andveturu Beautiful Desolation. Hra je bez DRM a je dostupná pro Linux, macOS i Windows.
articles.title: Hra zdarma: Beautiful Desolation

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedlouho po zranitelnosti Herzbleed procesorů AMD a Intel tu máme zranitelnost procesorů Intel: MMIO Stale Data. Chyba je označena jako CVE-2022–21123 a jde v podstatě o nedostatečné smazání sdílené vyrovnávací paměti procesoru, kudy by mohly lokálně uniknout citlivé informace mezi dvěma procesy.
articles.title: Zranitelnost procesorů Intel: MMIO Stale Data

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Od vydání Ubuntu 22.04 uživatelé často kritizují pomalý start Firefoxu, který je nově ve výchozím nastavení dodávaný jako snap. Canonical  se tedy zaměřil na zlepšení výkonu snapu. Výsledky shrnují dva zápisky v blogu Canonicalu od Olivera Smitha z konce května a ze včerejška.
articles.title: Canonical pracuje na zlepšení výkonu snapu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: PeoplePath)
articles.description: Dne 29. června 2022 od 18:00 společnost PeoplePath pořádá IT workshop s názvem Logujeme MySQL. Akce se koná v salonku v 1. patře v restauraci U Salzmannů v Plzni. Drobné občerstvení a pivo jsou samozřejmostí a vstupné je zdarma.
articles.title: ITWorkshop v Plzni: Logujeme MySQL

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Stěhule)
articles.description: Včera vyšla opravná verze PostgreSQL 14.4. Kromě jiných chyb je opravena závažná chyba v příkazu VACUUM. Tato chyba mohla způsobit poškození indexů vytvořených příkazem CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY nebo  REINDEX CONCURRENTLY.
articles.title: PostgreSQL 14.4 opravuje závažnou chybu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ferral Interactive včera vydal strategickou hru Total War: WARHAMMER III pro Linux. Koupit je možné v obchodě Ferral, na Steamu či v HumbleBundle za shodnou cenu 59,99 eur. Bohužel opět multiplayer je omezen a můžete hrát jen s hráči na stejném OS. Pokud tedy chcete hrát s hráči na Windows, je potřeba použít Proton (Wine).
articles.title: Total War: WARHAMMER III pro Linux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Příští pondělí a úterý se v Brně uskuteční další komunitní setkání nejen českých a slovenských správců sítí – CSNOG 2022. V programu této dvoudenní akce, která nabídne i prostor pro jednání a sdílení osobních zkušeností, najdou zájemci příspěvky zástupců organizací CZ.NIC, NIX.CZ, Kernun, NS1, Global NOG Alliance, Qrator Labs, Silicon Hill ČVUT nebo ČTÚ či Free Moscow University. Kompletní program včetně registračního formuláře jsou k dispozici na webu setkání. Organizátory CSNOG 2022 jsou sdružení CESNET, CZ.NIC a NIX.CZ.
articles.title: Česko-slovenské setkání správců sítí CSNOG 2022 se blíží

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Existuje-li pro fanouška open-source důvod, proč koupit jednu jedinou konkrétní desku do svého PC, pak jde o MSI Z690-A WiFi DDR4. Deska, která pojme aktuální procesory Intel Alder Lake, je první mainstreamovou a běžně dostupnou deskou, která je schopna běžet s open-source firmwarem Dasharo od společnosti 3mdeb, který dospěl do verze 1.0.
articles.title: Otevřený firmware Dasharo pro MSI Z690-A WiFi DDR4 je dokončen

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Trojková verze GIMPU stále není na světě, takže tu máme další aktualizaci dva-desítkové řady. Ta přináší vylepšení v podpoře formátů, vedle nadějného formátu JPEG XL (backport podpory z vývojové větve přidal Daniel Novomeský - díky) je tu import 8/16bit CMYK(A) TIFF a také podpora BigTIFF (nemá 4GB omezení velikosti souboru) či vylepšení podpory DDS, PSD či XCF a dalších.
articles.title: GIMP 2.10.32 přináší JPEG XL

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nově objevená zranitelnost procesorů od AMD a Intelu, která k prolomení šifrovacích algoritmů využívá specifické vlastnosti dynamického škálování frekvencí moderních CPU, dostala jméno Hertzbleed a vlastní domovskou stránku. Jde o prakticky použitelnou techniku, která je hrozbou pro veškerý kryptografický software, přičemž využívá novátorský útok proti SIKE (Supersingular Isogeny Key Encapsulation) k plné extrakci klíče za pomoci vzdáleného časování, navzdory tomu, že SIKE je implementován v konstantním čase.
articles.title: Hertzbleed, nová zranitelnost CPU od AMD a Intel

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Projekt desktopového prostředí KDE vydal novou verzi grafického rozhraní Plasma 5.25. Novinky jsme průběžně přinášeli v nedělních shrnutích, k dispozici je též aktuální přehled v oznámení této verze na domovském webu projektu (kde je i spousta ukázkových videí) i detailní soupis změn.
articles.title: Vyšla KDE Plasma 5.25 s vylepšeními dotykového ovládání

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Lucas Holt po téměř tři čtvrtě roce ohlásil novou verzi operačního systému MidnightBSD 2.2.0, stavějícího na FreeBSD. K dispozici je stále pro i386 i amd64 a zakládá na FreeBSD 12-stable.
articles.title: MidnightBSD 2.2.0 převádí roota z csh na tcsh

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: V Evropě máme nový superpočítač. Jmenuje se LUMI a staví kompletně na komponentách od AMD, které do výsledného superstroje od HPE budovali/budují v Kutné Hoře (fyzická instalace probíhá ve Finsku a je hotova zhruba z třetiny). Česká republika část nákladů zaplatila, takže naši vědci budou mít na LUMI menší část výpočetního času k dispozici.
articles.title: Evropský superpočítač LUMI staví na CPU a GPU AMD

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google definitivně vypne prastarou službu Google Talk, kterou provozoval od roku 2005. Byla postavena na protokolu XMPP a dnes je možné ji používat už jen přes klienty třetích stran jako Pidgin a Gajim. Služba ale bude i zbývajícím uživatelům vypnuta 16. června.
articles.title: Google po sedmnácti letech vypne službu Talk

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Open source nástroj Ventoy pro bootování ISO obrazů z USB flash disku jsme tu již měli ve sklizni. Včera pak vyšel ve verzi 1.0.76. Nově je ve výchozím stavu zapnut secure boot. Opraveno je několik chyb.
articles.title: Ventoy 1.0.76: více než 900 ISO obrazů bootujících z USB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: GitHub a potažmo Microsoft minulý týden oznámil ukončení vývoje úspěšného editoru Atom. Microsoft místo něj propaguje svůj VS Code. Ten však obsahuje telemetrii. Je sice možné tuto telemetrii vypnout, ale co když například Microsoftu nevěříte?
articles.title: Čím nahradit Atom? VSCodium

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Válečná situace na Ukrajině přiměla správce ukrajinské národní domény Hostmaster LLC požádat sdružení CZ.NIC o přesun části podpůrných systémů ukrajinského doménového registru do českého datacentra a zřízení autoritativního DNS clusteru pro doménu .UA na území České republiky.
articles.title: České servery podporují provoz ukrajinského doménového registru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Minulý týden vyšla oblíbená hra Minecraft ve verzi 1.19 Wild Update. Nyní došlo k sjednocení a všichni kdo mají Minecraft koupený, mají přístup k Java edici (Linux, macOS, Windows) i k Bedrock edici (Windows 10, 11, Xbox, PlayStation, Nintendo Switch, Android a iOS).
articles.title: Minecraft 1.19 Wild Update - Java a Bedrock za jedny peníze

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: VPN umožňuje bezpečně propojit různá zařízení pomocí šifrovaných tunelů. Umožňuje také zapojit uživatele do vnitřní sítě přes zabezpečený přístupový bod. Na našem školení VPN a bezpečné připojení k síti s OpenVPN si prakticky ukážeme, jak to celé nastavit a zprovoznit.
articles.title: Vytvořte si bezpečnou VPN pomocí OpenVPN (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Zakladatel Telegramu Pavel Durov v pátek oznámil Telegram Premium, placenou službu pro náročné uživatele, která bude zavedena patrně ještě tento měsíc. Uživatelé služby Premium budou mít dříve nové funkce, budou moci posílat větší soubory a budou mít exkluzivní nálepky (stickers) a reakce (reactions).
articles.title: Telegram bude mít prémiové předplatné

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Konference OpenAlt se po dvou letech online také vrací k osobnímu setkávání. Forma bude jako obvykle hybridní, konferenci bude možné sledovat offline i online zároveň. Aby bylo možné konferenci uspořádat offline, opustili jsme tradiční listopadový termín, vysvětlují organizátoři. Letos tedy bude konference OpenAlt už o víkendu 17. a 18. září 2022 na FIT VUT v Brně.
articles.title: OpenAlt proběhne v Brně 17. a 18. září

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ubuntu 22.04 na desktopu má ve výchozím stavu aktivovaný systemd-oomd, který v případě nedostatku paměti ukončí některé procesy. Problémem je, že tak činí příliš brzy, bez jakýchkoliv známek, že se blíží OOM. A také podle skóre často zabije Chrome či gnome-shell.
articles.title: Problémy se systemd-oomd v Ubuntu 22.04

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na serveru GOG.com můžete zdarma získat RPG hru Venetica – Gold Edition (pro získání hry jděte na první link a hledejte asi uprostřed stránky). Hra se odehrává ve fantasy Benátkách a ovládáte hrdinku Scarlett. Hra je sice dostupná pouze pro Windows, ale vypadá to, že je možné ji hrát s pomocí Wine.
articles.title: Hra zdarma na GOG.com: Venetica - Gold Edition

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ještě v březnu jsme psali, že rekord v počtu cifer čísla π je 63 biliónů. Ve středu však byl zveřejněn nový rekord výpočtu π, které bylo spočítáno na 100 biliónů cifer. Za výpočtem stojí  Emma Haruka Iwao z Google a k výpočtu byl použit Google Cloud se 128 virtuálními CPU a 864 GB RAM. Při výpočtu není až tak důležitá hrubá síla, jako spíše úložiště. K dispozici bylo 663 TB, z toho bylo použito 515 TB. Celkově bylo zapsáno 38,5 PB a přečteno 43,5 PB.
articles.title: Nový rekord výpočtu π od Google

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Máte spravovat síťové prvky společnosti MikroTik, ale chybí vám potřebné znalosti a zkušenosti? Přijďte na naše školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a kromě všech důležitých informací si domů odnesete i vlastní router MikroTik.
articles.title: Přijďte na školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a odnesete si router

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Zaměstnanci se naučili pracovat hybridně. Zvládají to také české firmy? Cisco spouští průzkum technologické připravenosti českých firem na home office a hybridní práci. Můžete se do průzkumu zapojit také.
articles.title: Průzkum ohledně hybridní práce

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: V proudu jarních vydání linuxových distribucí dorazil zvláště Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0, z jeho alternativních sestavení AlmaLinux a z těch pro RHEL 8.6 – Rocky Linux a Oracle Linux. Také se dostalo aktualizací FreeBSD, Kali Linuxu, Proxmox Backup Serveru, Clonezille Live, Alpine Linuxu či LXLE.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 20-21/2022

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description:
Hledáte možnost, jak upgradovat váš operační systém? Přestaňte hledat a získejte Windows a Office velmi levně.

Podívejte se proto na až bláznivě nízké ceny na tržišti Goodoffer24. Originální doživotní licence na operační systém Windows 10 a Microsoft Office tam můžete získat s velkými slevami hned teď.
articles.title: Získejte v pololetním výprodeji doživotní licenci na Windows 10 za € 11 a Office za € 23!

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Umíte vymyslet software, naprogramovat ho, zabalit do kontejneru a předat do produkce? Také vám říkali, že se open sourcem nedá uživit? Přijďte to zkusit u nás!
articles.title: Hledá se: Lone Wolf Developer for Linux [CESNET]

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Botnety už neslouží jen k útokům DDoS. Pure Storage představuje FlashBlade//S. Další vlna ransomwaru v roce 2022. V krizi pomáhají chytré technologie Průmyslu 4.0.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: V krizi pomáhají chytré technologie Průmyslu 4.0

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 23/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Jak vyrábět cihly na Marsu. Genetický editor CRISPR kouzlí s bramborami. Jak funguje kosmická pavučina. Tisk chytrých senzorů na dřevo.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Toulavé planety namísto kosmických lodí

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled květnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za květen 2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Vědci přišli na levnou výrobu nejlepšího grafenu. Umělá inteligence od Konica Minolta dokáže sledovat spokojenost zákazníků. Proč 85 % organizací do roku 2025 nasadí kontejnery? Poptávka po odbornících na kyberbezpečnost strmě roste, stejně tak i jejich platy. Dodavatelé alternativních cloudů na svou šanci teprve čekají.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Dodavatelé alternativních cloudů na svou šanci teprve čekají

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 22/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Za kolik antihmoty může běžná hmota? Zbývá něco na temnou? Nejsilnější marsotřesení. Ceres měl vzniknout až za Saturnem. Z atomů uhlíku sestavili Möbiovu pásku. Diamantová zrcadla pro výkonné lasery.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Zpřesnili hodnotu Hubbleovy konstanty, problém ale trvá

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Nejenom dle Miguela de Icazu Microsoft postupně uzavírá platformu .NET. Indicie například na stránce Is .NET an open platform yet? Miguel de Icaza je zakladatel projektů GNOME a Mono (open source implementace .NET) a společnosti Xamarin zastřešující vývoj Mona. Společnost Xamarin byla v roce 2016 koupena Microsoftem a Mono bylo přelicencováno na MIT. V březnu letošního roku Miguel de Icaza Microsoft opustil.
articles.title: Uzavírá Microsoft platformu .NET?

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Adventura Beautiful Desolation je na portále GOG.com zdarma, akce trvá do 20. června.
articles.title: Hra Beautiful Desolation na GOG zdarma

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Organizace Apache Software Foundation (ASF) vydala verzi 14 integrovaného vývojového prostředí a vývojové platformy napsané v Javě NetBeans (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek na GitHubu.
articles.title: Apache NetBeans 14

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Feral Interactive zabývající se portováním počítačových her na operační systémy macOS a Linux oznámila vydání Total War: WARHAMMER III pro Linux. Koupit lze na Steamu nebo ve Feral Storu za 59,99 €.
articles.title: Total War: WARHAMMER III pro Linux

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Greg Kroah-Hartman vydal Linux ve verzích 5.18.5, 5.15.48, 5.10.123, 5.4.199, 4.19.248, 4.14.284 a 4.9.319 (5.17 je již EOL). Řešena je zranitelnost MMIO (Memory Mapped I/O) Stale Data procesorů Intel.
articles.title: Nové verze Linuxu řešící zranitelnost MMIO (Memory Mapped I/O) Stale Data

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 3.5.0 interaktivního shellu fish (friendly interactive shell, Wikipedie). Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: fish shell 3.5.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Canonical vydal Ubuntu Core 22. Představení na YouTube. Nová verze Ubuntu Core vychází z Ubuntu 22.04 LTS a podporována bude 10 let. Ubuntu Core je určeno pro IoT (internet věcí) a vestavěné systémy.
articles.title: Ubuntu Core 22

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Článek na Libre Arts představuje nové open source API CLAP (CLever Audio Plug-in API) pro komunikaci mezi hostitelským audio programem a zásuvnými moduly. Po několika letech práce jej společně představily společnosti Bitwig a u-he. Jedná se o alternativu k VST, AU nebo LV2.
articles.title: CLAP (CLever Audio Plug-in API), nové open source API pro komunikaci mezi hostitelským audio programem a zásuvnými moduly

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Bylo vydáno Eclipse IDE 2022-06 aneb Eclipse 4.24. Představení novinek tohoto integrovaného vývojového prostředí také na YouTube.
articles.title: Eclipse IDE 2022-06 aneb Eclipse 4.24

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Tux Paint, tj. kreslicí program pro děti, slaví 20 let. První verze byla vydána 16. června 2002. Nejnovější verze je 0.9.28.
articles.title: Tux Paint slaví 20 let. Nová verze 0.9.28

articles.description: As a follow-up to last week's HP Dev One review for the HP laptop that is pre-loaded with System76's Pop!_OS and optimized for a good Linux experience complete with Fwupd/LVFS support, here are benchmarks of the HP Dev One while trying out Arch Linux, Ubuntu 22.04, Fedora Workstation 36, openSUSE Tumbleweed, and Clear Linux in addition to the default Pop!_OS 22.04 installation.
articles.title: The Performance Of Six Linux Distributions On The HP Dev One

articles.description: On top of the other Qt announcements today, Qt 6.4 Beta was just released to begin testing on this next half-year update to the Qt6 tool-kit...
articles.title: Qt 6.4 Beta Released With HTTP Server & 3D Physics Modules

articles.description: While the Raspberry Pi 4 has been out for nearly three years, only with the Linux 5.20 kernel later this summer is there anticipated to be the upstream open-source support within the V3D Direct Rendering Manager (DRM) driver...
articles.title: Raspberry Pi 4 V3D Open-Source Kernel Driver Support Slated For Linux 5.20

articles.description: Last month was the surprise announcement that longtime Qt developer Lars Knoll would be leaving The Qt Company.  Not only is he leaving as the CTO of The Qt Company but also as the longtime Qt Chief Maintainer for the open-source project, but now after voting by Qt developers, a new maintainer has been chosen...
articles.title: Lars Knoll Announces His Successor For Qt Chief Maintainer

articles.description: Venus as the VirtIO-GPU Vulkan driver within Mesa and developed by Google engineers just received a nice speed-up...
articles.title: Mesa's Venus Vulkan Driver Gets A Very Sizable Speed-Up

articles.description: SDL 2.0.22 was released back in April while now it's to be succeeded by the eventual SDL 2.24 stable and out today is the SDL 2.23.1 pre-release. Besides the shift in the versioning scheme there are many additions coming in this release for this library that's widely used by cross-platform games...
articles.title: SDL 2.23.1 Released With SDL2 Switching To A New Versioning Scheme

articles.description: Out today is a major release of the Fish shell that has been developed over the past decade and a half as a Unix shell rich on features and emphasis on usability...
articles.title: Fish Shell 3.5 Released With Many Scripting Improvements

articles.description: Mesa 22.1.2 was released today as the newest routine stable release update for this collection of open-source user-space graphics driver code...
articles.title: Mesa 22.1.2 Released With Many OpenGL / Vulkan Driver Fixes

articles.description: Feral Interactive today released their native Linux port of Total War: WARHAMMER III for Linux gamers...
articles.title: Feral Publishes Linux Port Of Total War: WARHAMMER III

articles.description: Disclosed on Tuesday was the set of Intel "MMIO Stale Data" vulnerabilities. Committed immediately at embargo lift was the mitigation patches for Linux 5.19 Git while the patches have now worked their way back to the maintained stable kernel series. Out this morning is a slew of stable kernel releases back to Linux 4.9 for patching the Intel MMIO Stale Data vulnerabilities that affect many generations of Intel CPUs from Rocket Lake and older...
articles.title: Stable Updates Back To Linux 4.9 Released For Intel MMIO Stale Data Vulnerabilities

articles.description: Mesa's V3DV driver for the Broadcom VideoCore GPU, which is most notably enabling open-source Vulkan API support for the Raspberry Pi 4 and newer, is nearly ready with its Vulkan 1.2 support...
articles.title: Raspberry Pi's V3DV Driver Nearly Across The Finish Line For Vulkan 1.2

articles.description: Slow start-up performance of the Firefox web browser has been a frequent complaint on Ubuntu Linux since Canonical shifted over to using the Snap'ed version of Firefox by default. It's certainly what I find most annoying with Ubuntu as well, but at least Canonical engineers continue working on addressing the performance and other awkward issues with the Firefox Snap...
articles.title: Canonical Continues Working On Ubuntu's Firefox Snap Performance

articles.description: Being worked on since 2020 has been Linux support for user-space peer-to-peer DMA between NVMe drives and yesterday marked the latest iteration of those patches...
articles.title: Linux Patches Revved For User-Space Peer-To-Peer DMA Between NVMe Drives

articles.description: FreeBSD a few days ago published its Q1'2022 status report highlighting all the advancements made by this open-source operating system project...
articles.title: FreeBSD Developers Continue Work On Shortening Boot Time, Improving WiFi Driver Support

articles.description: Released at the end of May was AlmaLinux 9.0 as the first "community" distribution out of the gates based on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 that reached GA in mid-May. I've been running AlmaLinux 9.0 on a few Intel and AMD servers to great success. And, yes, as expected the performance matches that of upstream RHEL9.
articles.title: AlmaLinux 9 Running Well, Performance On Par With RHEL 9.0

articles.description: The tenth alpha release of the Godot 4.0 open-source game engine is now available for testing with some interesting additions...
articles.title: Godot 4.0 Alpha 10 Brings Temporal AA

articles.description: Akamai Security Research today is lifting the public embargo on "Panchan", a new peer-to-peer botnet they are warning customers about that has been breaching Linux servers since March...
articles.title: Akamai Warns Of "Panchan" Linux Botnet That Leverages Golang Concurrency, Systemd

articles.description: Fwupd 1.7.8 was released this morning as the newest version of this open-source utility built around the Linux Vendor Firmware Service (LVFS) for easy and practical updating of system and component firmware under Linux...
articles.title: Fwupd 1.7.8 To Further Improve Firmware Updating On Linux

articles.description: Out today is the beta release of LibreOffice 7.4 as the newest feature release in development for this cross-platform, open-source office suite...
articles.title: LibreOffice 7.4 Beta Now Available With Performance Improvements, WebP Support

articles.description: Canonical has officially released Ubuntu Core 22 as its fully containerized version of Ubuntu 22.04 LTS that is optimized for IoT and edge computing use-cases...
articles.title: Ubuntu Core 22 Released For IoT & Embedded Devices

articles.description: With the in-development Linux 5.19 kernel there is compute engine support for DG2/Alchemist graphics now exposed to user-space. Besides the Intel OpenCL Runtime / oneAPI Level Zero preparing to make use of that compute engine support, patches merged today to Mesa 22.2 also allow enabling the DG2-class Arc Graphics compute support within the OpenGL/Vulkan drivers...
articles.title: Mesa 22.2 Adds Option To Enable Compute Engine For Intel Arc Graphics

articles.description: Earlier this year the folks at firmware consulting firm 3mdeb announced a open-source Coreboot port to a retail Intel Alder Lake motherboard. It's very exciting since outside of Chromebooks, IHV reference boards, and custom server platforms at hyperscalers, it's still rare to find Coreboot support on modern, retail boards. That "Dasharo" open-source firmware effort for the MSI Z690-A WiFi DDR4 has come together nicely over a matter of weeks and the developers are now celebrating their v1.0 release...
articles.title: Dasharo 1.0 Open-Source Firmware Released For MSI Alder Lake Motherboard

articles.description: Merged earlier this year into Mesa was "Dozen" for Vulkan on Direct3D 12 for use with Microsoft's Windows Subsystem for Linux or in Windows cases where there may be a D3D12 driver installed but no Vulkan support. This is akin to the layering work Microsoft already supports for leveraging Mesa to provide OpenCL and OpenGL atop Direct3D 12. That "Dozen" driver is now readying Vulkan 1.1 support...
articles.title: Microsoft's "Dozen" Prepares For Vulkan 1.1 Support

articles.description: Earlier this year Pensando engineers began posting Linux patches for enabling their Elba DPU SoC. This data processing unit is powered by 16 x Arm Cortex-A72 cores and designed for supporting up to dual 200GE networking with this SoC intended for high-end networking equipment. It didn't take long for the AMD integration less than one month after AMD completed its Pensando acquisition with the new Linux patches now reflected as the AMD Pensando Elba...
articles.title: Linux SoC Patches Revised For The AMD Pensando Elba

articles.description: Overnight Intel announced that the Arc A380 desktop GPU has launched in China and will begin appearing in the Chinese market this month...
articles.title: Intel Arc A380 Desktop Graphics Launch In China

articles.description: Valve today promoted Proton 7.0-3 to stable as the newest version of this software based on Wine and leveraging DXVK / VKD3D-Proton and other components for running Windows games with great success on Linux. Proton 7.0-3 is now available for Steam Play when firing up the Steam client while Valve also today issued a new Proton Experimental update...
articles.title: Proton 7.0-3 With More Games Running Well On Linux, Experimental Preps More Changes

articles.description: We have been writing about GIMP 3.0 for nearly a decade and with that stable release still out of sight, GIMP 2.10.32 is out as a six-month update to the aging GIMP 2.10 stable series...
articles.title: GIMP 2.10.32 Released With JPEG-XL Backported & Other Work While Waiting On GIMP 3.0

articles.description: In addition to the Hertzbleed frequency scaling side-channel attack being made public today as part of "Patch Tuesday" and affecting both Intel and AMD CPUs, Intel is additionally disclosing a set of "MMIO Stale Data" vulnerabilities. The Linux kernel has already been patched for these new vulnerabilities affecting multiple generations of Intel CPUs from Rocket Lake back to Haswell X and Skylake...
articles.title: Linux Patched For New Intel "MMIO Stale Data" Vulnerabilities

articles.description: Hertzbleed has been made public today as a new family of side-channel attacks making use of frequency side channels. Both Intel and AMD have issued security advisories as a result...
articles.title: Hertzbleed Disclosed As New Family Of Side-Channel Attacks Affecting Intel + AMD

articles.description: Last week with the release of Blender 3.2 bringing AMD HIP support for Linux to provide for Radeon GPU acceleration, I posted some initial benchmarks of AMD Radeon RX 6000 series with HIP against NVIDIA RTX with OptiX. There was interest by some Phoronix readers in also seeing NVIDIA CUDA results even though OptiX is in good shape with RTX GPUs, so with that here are results of NVIDIA CUDA vs. NVIDIA OptiX vs. AMD HIP with Blender 3.2 on Ubuntu Linux.
articles.title: AMD HIP vs. NVIDIA CUDA vs. NVIDIA OptiX On Blender 3.2

articles.description: KDE Plasma 5.25 is now shipping as the latest half-year major update to the KDE desktop...
articles.title: KDE Plasma 5.25 Released With Wayland Improvements, Improved Gestures

articles.description: Earlier this year Wine began experimenting with GitLab to improve their development workflow for this open-source project that allows Windows games and applications to run on Linux. It's now been decided that the GitLab workflow is useful and will now be their path forward...
articles.title: GitLab Now The Main Development Platform For Wine

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Activision Blizzard here, to tell you that Activision Blizzard has done nothing wrong
An internal investigation from Activision Blizzard's Board of Directors claims the company has found "no evidence" that its executives ignored or dismissed reported cases of harassment. The investigation, conducted by the Activision Blizzard board with external advisors, concludes the Board did not intentionally ignore or attempt to downplay instances of harassment that were reported.
An SEC filing details Activision Blizzard's assertions. The filing recognizes allegations from both the California Department of Fair Employment and Housing and those in the media, but says it determined there was no evidence.
"Contrary to many of the allegations, the Board and its external advisors have determined that ther…
articles.title: Activision internal investigation finds ‘no evidence’ it ignored harassment

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Well, we got a Smash Ultimate DLC out of it
Welp. ARMS is officially five years old as of June 16, 2022, and sadly, it's kind of been forgotten outside of a few references here and there. But you know what? I'm going to briefly talk about it and bring it back into the collective consciousness, even for one day.
I remember the very first time I played ARMS: it was in a warehouse for a Nintendo press tour, right before it was set to release. I felt the same about it as I did at the time of my review, and how I feel now: it's fun, but it never really reaches its full potential. I would have loved to have played it more, but my local scene was pretty rough, as a lot of folks didn't take to it; or understandably want to take the plunge for $60 (note: this game is still $60 digitally).
I'm a sucker for these types of arena fighters too! Anything where you can load up four players and go crazy, I'm there. I even played hours of The Bouncer multiplayer! At one point in time I'm pretty sure that was considered a felony.
Five years on, arguably, the biggest impact the ARMS IP made was as a DLC fighter (Min Min) in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate two years ago. Other than that, outside of a few sticker/logo references, it's faded into a distant memory.
But you know what? The memory of ARMS might be faded, but it's not lost...yet. It's still on Switch: a platform that's still going strong and fully supported. And if you own it: maybe boot up one more battle, for old spring's sake.
The post ARMS is officially five years old this week, and sadly no one really talks about it appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: ARMS is officially five years old this week, and sadly no one really talks about it

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Block-Boxing Beats
Street Fighter has always had a close relationship with its own dulcet tones, with each iteration in the classic fight franchise sporting a host of great, (and very occasionally not-so-great), tunes — Street Fighter 6 is looking to truly embrace these themes, with a street-grown hip-hop atmosphere to match its alleyway visuals and nightclub fashion wardrobe.
Yesterday, Capcom released full versions of three SF6 character themes, sounding the siren for the arrival of three of the sequel's currently confirmed characters. Sitting in the jukebox today are shoto master Ryu, crimestopper Chun-Li, and braggadocious military brat Luke. So crank up the volume, sonny, and let's check 'em out.
Luke - "Taking Aim"
https://twitter.com/StreetFighter/status/1535351095618248704?s=20&t=U…
articles.title: Check out the Street Fighter 6 themes for Ryu, Chun-Li, and Luke

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
I mean, get it if you don't have it
Celeste quickly became one of the most relevant platformers in the past five years or so, and if you haven't partaken yet, now is the time. Both Celeste and TowerFall are on sale for five bucks on the Switch eShop.
The news comes via Extremely OK Games (the creators behind both titles), and the interesting part of the announcement is that in addition to North America, it's also on sale in Europe: including parts of Europe it's never been on sale before in the past.
While TowerFall is easily better with local players behind it, Celeste is a must-buy in any context. Seriously, if you even remotely enjoy platformers, just get it for that price. It'll last you through the weekend and then some, and odds are you'll be thinking about it long after that. And even if you don't normally like platformers or struggle with them, it has some extra options to tweak to make things a little more manageable.
You can find Celeste here on Switch, and TowerFall on sale here. The Switch is a great platform for both! Portability suits Celeste as it has echoes of a Game Boy title, and TowerFall, with its party atmosphere, makes sense for a Nintendo console.
https://twitter.com/exok_games/status/1536839850346696704
The post Celeste and TowerFall are currently five bucks on Switch appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Celeste and TowerFall are currently five bucks on Switch

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
The sale runs until June 23
Dragon's Dogma is on sale right now, in part to celebrate the announcement of the sequel late last night in an errant Capcom stream.
So the general gist of the sale is a roughly 84% off discount on every platform but Switch, where it's 66% off. Here's the breakdown, with links:
PC/Steam - $4.79 - PC/GOG - $5.09 - Humble Bundle
Xbox (playable on Xbox One/Series X and S) - $4.49
PSN (playable on PS4 and PS5) - $4.79
Switch - $9.99
For under five bucks, Dragon's Dogma is definitely worth it. It's one of the wildest games of the last 10 years or so, offering up an epic adventure with all sorts of wonkiness to boot. That price will help the latter elements go down smoother, and given that it's not for everyone, even if you abandon it eventually you won't have spent too much on it.
In that sense, the sequel is a massive opportunity to correct the technical sins of its father. It took a long time, but Dragon's Dogma (partially through the Arisen release) garnered a lot of goodwill within the gaming community, as it was an honest effort at a unique open world experience, with a bit of flair. If they can shore things up with an updated RE Engine foundation, it could take off even more.
The post Dragon’s Dogma is on sale for under $5 on PC/PS/Xbox: on Switch it’s $10 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Dragon’s Dogma is on sale for under $5 on PC/PS/Xbox: on Switch it’s $10

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Fighting Back
In 2021, Capcom released two exclusive charity skins for its formative fighter Street Fighter V — The skins, which were made available for franchise heroes Ryu and Chun-Li, were sold for $5.99 each, with Capcom promising to donate all proceeds of the sales to the Breast Cancer Research Foundation (BCRF).
Yesterday, the publisher revealed that it had raised an impressive total of $75,000 USD for the Street Fighter V skins, money which Capcom states equates to around 1500 hours of research into the detection and curing of breast cancer, which remains one of the most predominant forms of the cellular disease, affecting millions of women across the globe each and every year.
https://twitter.com/StreetFighter/status/1537540682704879617?s=20&t=Drwti_cr2yV805WNH0oUdw
"This year, bre…
articles.title: Street Fighter V skins raised $75,000 for Breast Cancer Research Foundation

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
I mean, good songs are kind of the norm in this series
So far, Xenoblade Chronicles 3 is putting its best foot forward. We'll see how it fares come July, but for now, I'm pretty happy with what Nintendo is showing off. And that includes this new beautiful Xenoblade Chronicles 3 song called "A Life Sent On."
Shared by way of the Nintendo UK Twitter account, the track is described as a "somber flute-based melody," which is played by "off-seers" in the universe (specifically Noah and Mio) to mourn people who have fallen in battle. Based on the small amount of lore we have, off-seers are tasked with some sort of guidance for a facet of the afterlife, and could potentially play a larger role in the narrative.
For now, I've listened to this particular Xenoblade Chronicles 3 song a bunch of times now (even when writing this!) and it's giving me extremely good vibes for how the game will turn out. Aesthetically it seems to be nailing everything it needs to, as that's arguably been one of the stronger points of the series from the start: outdoing other similar games on the same hardware.
Hopefully we get even more quality of life upgrades and a killer story. There's a lot to improve upon in the second core game mechanically.
Listen to the Xenoblade Chronicles 3 track A Life Sent On
https://twitter.com/NintendoUK/status/1534828335804649474
[Update: And another song just dropped! It's called "The Weight of Life," and you can listen to it below.]
Listen to the Xenoblade Chronicles 3 track The Weight of Life
https://twitter.com/NintendoEurope/status/1537344232058413057
[Update #2: And another track is out! Keves Battle.]
Listen to the Xenoblade Chronicles 3 track Keves Battle
https://twitter.com/NintendoUK/status/1537751916482023429
The post If this song is any indication, the Xenoblade Chronicles 3 soundtrack will be a banger appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: If this song is any indication, the Xenoblade Chronicles 3 soundtrack will be a banger

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
June 24
Pokemon Snap 64 will make its debut on Nintendo Switch on June 24, Nintendo has announced. It'll join the newer 2021 iteration on the same platform.
Originally released in 1999 on the Nintendo 64, the picture-taking simulator became an instant cult classic. In a sense, it's the perfect game to come to a subscription service, as the concept is kind of out there, to the point where a lot of folks would never go out of their way to seek it out, but if a lot of those same people gave it a shot, they'd really enjoy it.
The Nintendo 64 side of things has been particularly slow-going, as far as the expansion pack is concerned. So originally Nintendo launched the service back in October with nine games. Since then they've doled out an additional game per month, including Paper Mario, Banjo Kazooie, Majora's Mask, F-Zero X, Mario Golf, Kirby 64, and now Pokemon Snap 64. That's a grand total of 16 games. The Genesis side has fared a little better, as Nintendo generally drops three or more games at once on that expansion pack line, albeit at a less regular cadence.
Switch Online is kind of all over the place in terms of value. Hopefully it'll improve at some point as early as this year.
https://twitter.com/NintendoAmerica/status/1537604982043725824
The post Pokemon Snap 64 is coming to Switch Online next week appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Pokemon Snap 64 is coming to Switch Online next week

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
It's a full remaster of the PSP exclusive
Square Enix is remastering Crisis Core, and it's arriving pretty soon. Crisis Core Final Fantasy VII Reunion is a remaster of the 2007 prequel to Final Fantasy VII, and it's coming to PC and consoles this winter.
The news was announced during today's Final Fantasy VII 25th Anniversary Celebration showcase. The original Crisis Core is a prequel story to Final Fantasy VII proper, following Zack Fair's mission to find missing SOLDIER Genesis Rhapsodos. This new version looks to follow the same story, but with an updated look and feel.
Square Enix is calling it a full remaster. Reunion will have HD graphics and all 3D models refreshed. Dialogue will be fully voice-acted, and there's a new soundtrack arrangement as well.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aRBiRFM2k0I
Crisis Core Final Fantasy VII Reunion is planned to launch on both PC and modern consoles. That means PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch, and PC via Steam. No news on a firm date just yet.
All's Fair in love and remasters
According to Square Enix, you won't need to have played Final Fantasy VII or Final Fantasy VII Remake in order to play Crisis Core Reunion. It also works as a standalone story, with its own adventure that unfolds.
That said, the expanded universe stuff is really all about seeing it all come together. And considering how Zack seems to be playing a big part in the also-announced Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, this might be a good bit of homework to do before next winter.

The big question is, obviously, will any of the story content change? Zack Fair's status in the Remake continuum is clearly quite different from the original. Remake also seems to be linked to the original series, in a very Rebuild of Evangelion manner. Things are about to get wacky and wild with the timeline and deeper lore questions. Hopefully we get some answers this winter.
The post Crisis Core Final Fantasy VII Reunion arrives this winter for PC, consoles appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Crisis Core Final Fantasy VII Reunion arrives this winter for PC, consoles

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Ever Crisis' closed beta is on the way
Final Fantasy VII: Ever Crisis is something we've been looking forward to for a while -- initially announced last year, this new title will bring the entirety of the Final Fantasy VII timeline to mobile platforms as a single-player, episodic experience. That's right, we're getting the story of the original Final Fantasy VII game, as well as all of its companion titles in one little package, as well as some new story elements surrounding the foundation of SOLDIER, as written by Kazushige Nojima. How fun!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G53XnZSzRRU
During the Final Fantasy VII 25th Anniversary stream today, Square Enix announced that Final Fantasy VII: Ever Crisis is getting a closed beta sometime this year. The game will be free-to-play with in-game purchases.
The post Final Fantasy VII: Ever Crisis is getting a closed beta sometime this year appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Final Fantasy VII: Ever Crisis is getting a closed beta sometime this year

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
The series will be three parts in full
Today, we got our first look at the next entry in the Final Fantasy VII Remake series. Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is the second of three planned entires, Square Enix confirmed today, and will arrive next winter for PS5.
The trailer closed out today's Final Fantasy VII 25th Anniversary Celebration.  In it, we see Cloud walking around in an open area, soon joined by Sephiroth. The pair walk around a massive area, as questions circle around.

Cut-in text asks what will happen to the planet, and what Sephiroth's endgame is. At one point, someone asks if she's some kind of impostor. Then we see Zack and Cloud, walking towards Midgar, same as they were in the ending of Final Fantasy VII Remake.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5wRnP5aYlLA
Final Fantasy VII se…
articles.title: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is the next of the remakes, coming next winter

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
"Sorry to have kept you waiting"
During the Dragon's Dogma 10th anniversary stream, Capcom kept us waiting, but finally confirmed what we've all been waiting for: a sequel is happening! Dragon's Dogma II is real.
Game director Hideaki Itsuno spoke about his origins with RPGs and the development process for the still-unique-to-this-day Dragon's Dogma before showing his new t-shirt and confirming that, yes, Dragon's Dogma II is "currently in development."
Here's... the sequel's logo:

To be clear, no gameplay footage — not even a snippet — was shown. No window, either.
According to Itsuno, "everyone in the development team is hard at work creating a game that we hope you will enjoy." He closed the stream with a classic "please look forward to it," and that was it. After much speculation, I'm just glad it's now out in the open.
Dragon's Dogma is something of a flawed (and charmingly funny) gem, and while we did eventually get Dark Arisen, the time is right for a firing-on-all-cylinders sequel. The series has picked up fans over the years — it even got a Netflix anime adaptation — and it's clear that Itsuno is passionate about returning to high-fantasy role-playing action.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ORz9ArXP-Ww
Imagine your Pawns in the RE Engine
After the stream, Capcom confirmed that Dragon's Dogma II will use the RE Engine.
Not that many games could get my imagination this fired up with just a logo announcement, but then again, Dragon's Dogma isn't most games. While details are basically non-existent at this point, it's easy to imagine how cool some of these creatures will look in a modern engine and how ridiculous our friendly neighborhood Pawns will be.
Coming off of Elden Ring, I'm so ready to see what Capcom can deliver.
The post Dragon’s Dogma II is officially happening appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Dragon’s Dogma II is officially happening

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Our favorite remake is headed to Steam
Final Fantasy VII is considered one of the best games of all time, and as we celebrate its 25th anniversary, this game is the gift that keeps on giving. An enhanced and expanded version of the remake, Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade, is already available on the PS5 and the Epic Games Store. We learned today during the Final Fantasy VII 25th Anniversary Celebration stream that the Intergrade version is also going to be on Steam as of June 17, and the game will be playable on the Steam Deck as well.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M4t1OFONu10
Intergrade comes bundled with INTERmission, which is new story content for the game featuring Yuffie as the main character. There are other new gameplay and content features, including Fort Condor, as part of the game as well.
Similar to the PC launch of Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade on the Epic Games Store, the Steam version costs $69.99 — but there's a discount knocking it down to $49.69 until July 7.
The post Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade is available on Steam appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade is available on Steam

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
A lot can happen in 10 minutes
June isn't done yet, and this afternoon, we've got another gaming showcase to watch. It's about time to check out the Final Fantasy VII 25th Anniversary Celebration, which will be streaming live at 3:00 p.m. Pacific today. What's on the docket? Officially, Square Enix has promised "all the latest information relating to the 25th anniversary of Final Fantasy VII."
Depending on who you ask (and which leaks you believe), this stream could touch on many different things — a Steam release of Final Fantasy VII Remake, a coveted glimpse of FFVII Remake Part 2, and potentially even some FFVII "expanded universe" news.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wohQiEysqIA
You can watch the event live on YouTube and Twitch.
While the FFVII 25th Anniversary Celebration stream is supposed to be on the shorter side, the hype for this event has really snowballed in the past 24 hours, as is the way.
Admittedly, I'm less interested in hearing about stuff like The First Soldier and Ever Crisis, and with Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 2 such an unknown quantity at this point, I'm sure many of you feel the same way. If we get anything concrete on the Naoki Hamaguchi-directed game, and maybe a fun wild-card announcement, I'll be happy. A few details — heck, even a bit of familiar imagery to latch onto — can go a long way while we wait.
(Worth reminding: if Dragon's Dogma is more your speed, Capcom is also hosting a 10th anniversary stream at the exact same time. I'm feeling reserved yet hopeful.)
Y'all ready for this?
Recap — that was a great showing!
Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade is available on Steam tomorrow
Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is the next of the remakes, coming next winter
Final Fantasy VII: Ever Crisis is getting a closed beta sometime this year
Crisis Core Final Fantasy VII Reunion arrives this winter for PC, consoles
It's nice to still feel a bit of that "E3" spark.
The post Let’s watch the Final Fantasy VII 25th Anniversary Celebration appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Let’s watch the Final Fantasy VII 25th Anniversary Celebration

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Making crossplay more accessible
There's nothing more annoying than going to play a game with a friend, only to realize that you can't play together because you own the game on different platforms — it's a struggle we've all had to deal with at one point or another. Thanks to Epic's new free release of PC crossplay tools for developers, though, we're one step closer to eliminating the blues that come with platform-exclusive play.
According to a blog post on the Epic Online Services website, they're delivering "a single set of services for game development on any engine, any store, and any platform" that are "proven to scale in some of the largest games."
These tools allow for a ton of features on the Epic Games Store, like being about to merge friends lists between Steam and the Epic Store…
articles.title: Epic releases free PC crossplay tools for developers

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Get some good jams for your next world-record attempt
Neon White went live today, on Nintendo Switch and PC, for anime speedrunning freaks everywhere. But even if you're not into going fast in an anime world, you should also take some time to check out the Neon White OSTs from Machine Girl that hit Bandcamp today.
Artist Machine Girl composed not one, but two OSTs—or original soundtracks—for Neon White. They're the tunes that play in the background as you speed along, zipping from demon to demon and blazing through the outer limits of heaven. They're extremely good.
Check out this track, dubbed The Wicked Heart, from the first OST. It starts out at full throttle, with punchy drums and raw noise bleeding throughout the track. The melody drops in around the 1:13 mark and is one of my favorites in Neon White.
Neon White OST 1 - The Wicked Heart by Machine Girl
Neon White and catch some relaxed, easygoing beats. It's perfect for kicking back after a long day of setting records.
Neon White OST 2 - The Burn That Cures by Machine Girl
Tracks like Bloody Sneakers, the theme for Neon Violet, almost remind me of early PlayStation days. I think of the Racing Lagoon soundtrack, and in the best way possible.
Neon White OST 2 - The Burn That Cures by Machine Girl
Beats to blast your record in half
What I'm saying is, the Neon White OSTs are a jam. It's already a contender for best soundtrack of the year, in my book.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X0b-qZTF0Mc
As for Neon White itself, it's great. I've spent the last week setting and then besting my times, competing with other early players along the way. It's anime as heck, like the sort of series you'd find on a VHS tape in the '90s at your local mom-and-pop rental place. Suffice to say, if you like going fast, Neon White is worth your time—and it's got some killer beats, too.
The post The Neon White OSTs are on Bandcamp, and they’re fantastic appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The Neon White OSTs are on Bandcamp, and they’re fantastic

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
Coming to PC, Nintendo Switch, and yes, Atari VCS
If you ask me, not enough creators are playing in the WarioWare-esque microgame space. We got a new game last year on Nintendo Switch, sure, but a big part of the fun is that initial discovery phase before you've got every zany "think fast!" task figured out. With that in mind, I may not be super into Atari, but the idea behind Atari Mania sounds great.
Atari Mania has 150+ microgames built on the brand's legacy, from Pong to Adventure to Yars' Revenge. The team says that we'll "never think of Bentley Bear the same way again."
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-QErw-mKwLg
In the game, you'll play as the Atari Vault caretaker, so there's a wider story element to bind the '70s- and '80s-inspired microgames together. There are "dead pixels" to stop.
As for the gameplay structure, it'll be a gauntlet of escalating microgames in a random order, culminating in boss battles. So you'll need to be quick and consistent to survive.
Beyond today's trailer, Atari Mania developer iLLOGIKA also confirmed collectibles like "vintage Atari art, posters, manuals, and fun facts," along with "fully playable versions of remastered Atari classics" that can be unlocked via challenges.
[caption id="attachment_330595" align="alignnone" width="1920"] One of many microgames. Note the timer bar at the bottom.[/caption]
For me, it's mostly going to come down to the individual microgames more than anything else — are they fun? Surprising? How deep are these cuts? That said, it's good to hear that there's more substance with collectibles, and the price seems reasonable enough.
Atari Mania will launch on Steam, Nintendo Switch, and Atari VCS this summer for $19.99.
The post Atari Mania is a retro-fueled microgame collection appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Atari Mania is a retro-fueled microgame collection

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
iOSterra
Square Enix has opened pre-registration for western players interested in its upcoming mobile RPG Octopath Traveler: Champions of the Continent. Interested parties can sign up for the new release ahead of its launch on iOS and Android platforms this summer.
Set once again in the lavish lands of Orsterra, Octopath Traveler: Champions of the Continent will feature the fantasy RPG action and deep storytelling lore of the original 2018 adventure, stylized with that "retro 2D sprites on 3D rendered backgrounds" aesthetic that all of these mobile spin-offs tend to rock. Choose a party of "Chosen Ones" from the 64 available characters, before embarking upon a branching narrative packed with exploration, adventure, and oodles of juicy monster battles.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qKYvONIJ3tE
"A few years prior to the events of Octopath Traveler, Orsterra is ruled by tyrants hungry for “wealth, power, and fame," reads an official blurb. "While the tyrants’ desires have unleashed a bottomless darkness upon the world… there are those who resist the darkness. You will meet them while traveling the world as “the Chosen Ones” of a divine ring. What will you obtain, and what will you experience through this journey? Soon the story will lead you to the tyrants of the land."
Champions of the Continent sports the stunning art style of its predecessor and features familiar and original tunes from series composer Yasunori Nishiki. Very unlike the original release, however, the mobile edition of Octopath Traveler is a free-to-play title that also features a variety of in-app purchases. I'm sure that you'd already put this together, but it's still worth clarifying.
Octopath Traveler: Champions of the Continent will launch on iOS and Android platforms this summer.
The post Octopath Traveler: Champions of the Continent registration opens on mobile appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Octopath Traveler: Champions of the Continent registration opens on mobile

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
See some "show floor" demos from the comfort of home
The indie gaming side of Xbox is hosting another demo event this year, the ID@Xbox Summer Game Fest Demo event. Starting on June 21, the ID@Xbox team says it will have over 30 demos of upcoming games playable on Xbox.
These demos will be up from June 21 through the 27th, so be sure to check them out while the window's open. And ID@Xbox notes that these demos are not the average demos you'd usually see on stores. While those usually come from fairly completed games, the ones in ID@Xbox are more akin to "show floor demos" you might catch at PAX or something. Basically, these are early-stage projects, so be constructive if things seem a little rough.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nBskR9Pcv7o
The full list of demos is arriving closer to June 21, but ID@Xbox showed four of them today. These include:
Batora: Lost Haven: An isometric action game where you journey through colorful planets and fight to save Earth using your physical and mental superpowers.
Broken Pieces: A time-based thriller that seems ideal for Control fans, where you have to solve the mystery of this bizarre French village.
Severed Steel: One for the blood-pumping FPS fans, it's got bullet-time and destructible environments.
Tinykin: A Pikmin-style game that we've had our eye on for a while, with an incredible look and tons of little helpers.
Dozens of demos galore
It's already been a pretty good summer for demos. The Steam Next Fest is on right now, and there are a ton of upcoming projects to discover and add to your wishlist there.
Last year's ID@Xbox demo event had some pretty great hands-on previews in the lineup too. Games like Tunic, Lake, Sable, and more were all part of the 2021 demo fest. It'll be exciting to see what pops up in this year's event.
The post ID@Xbox Summer Game Fest Demo event kicks off next week appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: ID@Xbox Summer Game Fest Demo event kicks off next week

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Fly the Anthro Airlines
Chocks away, my furry friends, AkSys Games has released its cute, anthropomorphic shmup Horgihugh and Friends on Switch, bringing its challenging but totes-adorbs sky fighting action to the Nintendo platform. It is available to download from the eShop today, priced at around $30.
You can check out a trailer for the fun-looking arcade blaster below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pbFFTZ706ew
In the aftermath of a brutal world war, a fantastical, furry take on the planet has fully disarmed itself of all weapons in order to prevent such an atrocity from taking place again. Unfortunately, the skies are now under siege from an invading intergalactic force, The Gozareans, and with nowhere else left to turn, it is up to a party of retired pilots to take to the air in their vintage battle planes, squaring up against the invaders despite being both outmanned and severely outgunned.
Horgihugh and Friends boasts cheerful, cartoonish artwork by industry veteran Kou (Shantae, Mega Man X2) and a rousing soundtrack composed by Motoaki Furukawa (Metal Gear, Policenauts). As animalkind's last hope, players will blast their way through six stages of pew-pew action, gathering power-ups, swiftly dodging a skyful of projectiles, and taking on a seemingly endless army of drones, captained by no less than 13 unique boss characters.
I'd been hoping to get to this release for review, but the relentlessness of the Not-E3 news season has unfortunately prevented me from doing so. Nevertheless, I'll be sure to check it out. Chocks Away!
The post Horgihugh and Friends takes to the skies on Nintendo Switch today appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Horgihugh and Friends takes to the skies on Nintendo Switch today

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
Seasonal updates every nine weeks
During the Overwatch 2 Reveal Event this morning, Blizzard elaborated (somewhat!) on its free-to-play launch and what's in the content pipeline for this live-service sequel.
If you've been waiting to hear more about PvE, welp, that wasn't the focus of today's stream — and the new story missions won't be playable until 2023 — but we've got a roadmap for PvP and confirmation that loot boxes are out and a battle pass format is in.
Coming off of Overwatch 1, the team's main goal is to try and deliver content on a "frequent and consistent basis," according to game director Aaron Keller.
Currently, they're committing to major updates every nine weeks, starting with the launch on October 4. "Players can expect to see a new hero every other season, with elements l…
articles.title: Overwatch 2 shared its seasonal roadmap and battle pass plan

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Stuffed Crust
Today sees the launch of nostalgic smack-'em-up Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder's Revenge, (you can check out our review right here), but while the Heroes in a Half-Shell have only just returned to the streets, fans are already poking the developer squad on the possibility of post-release DLC.
In an interview with Xbox Expansion Pass, Tribute Games' Yannick Belzil was asked about the possibility of alternate character skins, for example, the turtles' penchant for trilbies and overcoats. In a response that makes perfect sense, Belzil noted that the distinct animated style of Shredder's Revenge prevents the team from altering the sprites too much, and thus alternate costumes are unlikely to be on deck, now or at anytime in the future.
https://youtu.be/GemOAwU-9fo
However, following some misleading "No DLC at all"-style headlines, Dotemu's Cyrille Imbert took to Twitter to clarify that while there are currently no plans for post-launch content, factors such as public perception and player feedback could decide whether the team returns to Shredder's Revenge at some point in the future. I'm sure, right now, they'd just like to rest up after a job well done.
Put simply: There are no DLC plans now. There could be in the future.
TMNT: Shredder's Revenge is a solid and fun brawler, but there is room, should Dotemu decide, for additional modes — such as Time Attack, Boss Rush, Endless, or 1CC. The TMNT lore runs deep, so should Tribute Games choose to add extra stages and/or characters, it would be understandably welcomed by fans. But all of this is putting the cart well before the horse. The game isn't even a single day old yet. But for those players who prefer the chase to the catch (seemingly all modern video game fans), know that future content ideas haven't been flushed down the sewer just yet.
TMNT: Shredder's Revenge launches today on PS4, PC, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch.
The post No plans but possibility of TMNT: Shredder’s Revenge DLC appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: No plans but possibility of TMNT: Shredder’s Revenge DLC

Prime members get a ticket to fight the Reapers
Amazon's Prime Day is coming up, where it offers a bunch of deals specifically for its subscribing members. On the games side of things, that includes a few freebies.
